link.digest: Familiarising yourself with the FrameLib library.

link.name: 03_fl_concepts
link.digest: The key concepts of FrameLib, such as its timing and patching architecture.

link.digest: Methods for converting data between the Max and FrameLib domains.

link.name: 05_fl_generators
link.digest: An overview of 'generator' objects belonging to the FrameLib eco-system.

link.digest: A step-by-step guide to building a granular synthesiser in Framelib from scratch.

link.name: 07_fl_fft
link.digest: The Basics of FFT/STFT processing in FrameLib

link.name: 08_fl_multistream
link.digest: Similar to 'mc' objects, multi-streaming allows you to manipulate multiple streams with a single set of processors.

link.name: 09_fl_multiresfft
link.digest: Constructing multi-resolution FFT processes in FrameLib.

link.name: 10_fl_ir
link.digest: A small overview of working with impulse responses and convolution.

li.link: Tutorial 10: Working with impulse responses in FrameLib.

link.name: 11_fl_nrt
link.digest: Designing, converting and understanding FrameLib networks in the non-realtime mode.

link.name: 13_fl_export
link.digest: Exporting your FrameLib networks from Max to C++ to be used in other environments and applications.

li.link: Tutorial 13: Exporting FrameLib from Max to C++.
